attributes.action: Reaffirm and support equality and worker's rights in post-EU Britain.
attributes.background:
Following the vote to leave the EU, it is likely that the UK will cease to be bound by EU laws, which underpin vital legal protections for British citizens.

The undersigned call upon MPs to reaffirm those acts such as the Employment Rights Act (1996) and Equality Act (2010).
attributes.additional_details:
The undersigned also ask MPs to reject weakening of principles established in EU laws such as:
The Working Time Regulations, 
The Pregnant Workers Directive, 
The Parental Leave Directive, 
The Information and Consultation of Employees Directive (adopted as the Works Council Directive in UK law), 
The Equality Framework Directive, 
The Race Equality Directive, 
The Equal Treatment Directive, 
The Insolvency Protection Directive

attributes.action: Make it law for sun tan lotions to show the Uva star rating on the packaging
attributes.background: The uva star rating provides us with the broad spectrum cover that the sun cream gives us. The EU standard is 3 star but advice is given that we should be looking for a 4 or 5 star. Many brands do not publish what their rating is so the consumer can not make an informed decision when buying.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.bad.org.uk/for-the-public/skin-cancer/sunscreen-fact-sheet

attributes.action: True democracy, Call a referendum if you get 100,000 signatures.
attributes.background: Call a referendum if you get 100,000 signatures. Regardless what it's for. bringing the power back to the people. Let the people decide the future of the UK not politicians or local government we have the power to change and do what is right for the future of the UK

attributes.action: Set aside parliamentary time to debate banning petitions.
attributes.background: Petitions are becoming the bane of our existence. Hardly a day passes without some irritant imploring us to support one in a vain attempt to get the Government to do something of very little consequence instead of spending precious parliamentary time on something of significance.

attributes.action: Introduce minimum professional qualifications for marketing services in the UK.
attributes.background: Considering the damage that poor advice or deliberate mis-selling of marketing services can do to our local & regional economies, it's time minimum professional qualifications were introduced to ensure protection for SME's across the UK. Greater accountability in marketing & advertising is required.

attributes.action:
Review how the fines system works.
Using a percentage of total income.
attributes.background:
It would be a much fairer system if the system had a set percentage of total income for any fines handed out, as such the detterant isnt the same to a someone with a high income as it may be to someone on a lower income.
It also lessens the penalty if it is having no effect on the offender.
attributes.additional_details:
I feel this is pretty self explanatory, please review how the fines system is worked, it is an unfair system that currently penalises only people with smaller incomes.

Whilst not acting as a deterrent at all to high income earners.

If the system was worked off a percentage of total income then it would be much fairer to all, no matter how much money they have.
The percentage could increase the worse the crime, this may be a larger deterrent to all offenders.

attributes.action: England to have a bank holiday every 1st Monday of every month.
attributes.background: We as a nation are overworked. We do not spend enough time enjoying the little things in life with the people that matter.

attributes.action: Increase CSA amount for paying parents on benefits.
attributes.background: At this present moment in time the flat rate for parent paying CSA towards their children is a flat rate of £7 per week regardless of how many children you have. Rightly a packet of nappies cost much higher then this. Benefit parents shouldn't get away with the responsibility of paying petty money.

attributes.action: Increase winter fuel payments and make them taxable.
attributes.background: This is a universal benefit but is not paid to pensioners living in the EU. A precedent that this benefit is not universal but is paid on the basis of need. Thus it should be either taxed or means tested. It cannot be different rules for UK pensioners who choose to live in the EU.

attributes.action: Stop birth certificate stating "Father Unknown" when the father doesn't register
attributes.background: When registering a babies birth, if the father is not in attendance, either by being unwilling or unable, the father is shown on the certificate as Unknown. I find this unacceptable as it suggests the mother is promiscuous. Please remove the word Unkown and leave blank or allow Unwilling.

attributes.action: Impose age ratings on music videos using the same system used for films.
attributes.background: Some music videos (such as Rihanna's "Better Have My Money" video) contain themes (i.e. glorified cruelty, drug use and nudity) which are inappropriate for children but have no age restrictions.
attributes.additional_details: Parents can't always stop their children from watching videos like this as it can be shown to them by school friends, and or watched on their phones and iPads. It is not always possible for parents to know, and control, what their children are watching. And these videos can be watched by children as young as primary school age. Please sign this petition and help stop this.

attributes.action: Lower the cost or remove the cost of PRS & PPL Licensing
attributes.background: Many people over the years has been paying mega amount for a piece of paper that will allow you to create an online radio station. The costs per year vary from £545 - £2000. Myself and others think it should be removed in general. Let young people run a station without the fear of getting a fine!

attributes.action: Make it mandatory for smart meters to work regardless of supplier
attributes.background: I phoned B Gas and requested to change our gas meter to a smart meter. They stated that unless I bring my electricity to them they can't provide a smart meter. They further stated that if I change the supplier at any time the smart meter will not function due to their accounting system.
attributes.additional_details: All accounting systems are now universal and I feel the Select Committee should question British Gas. Why do they insist on customers bringing their electric supply and not install a smart meter for gas supply only for which they are supplier to the property? It is a very serious issue and I humbly request the Chairman of the Select Committee to question British Gas. I do want a Smart Meter installed without any conditions attached. There is clear indication of the MONOPOLY for energy supply.

attributes.action: Establish extradition treaties so British victims of crime are supported.
attributes.background: I want to raise the issue of the safety of British Nationals and their families overseas and develop on the international extradition treaties and assistance that is in place.
attributes.additional_details: If you or a member of your family has been subjected to a crime a suspected criminal can flee to another country or back to the UK that has no treaty in place and will not face any criminal proceedings.

attributes.action: Lower prescription charges
attributes.background:
Even being a full time employee, I find £8.20 a lot of money to have to find whilst I also have a family to support.
I understand that something should be paid but I dispute having to pay out all that especially when my health has gone down and have had to have 2 separate prescriptions in 2 weeks.
attributes.additional_details:
The government need to get the charges lowered as before long, prescription payers will rather stay sick then pay out all that money for an NHS prescription.
I also pay my national insurance and would rather pay a little more to have cheaper or free prescriptions as a UK tax payer.
Please join and sign the petition to ask to get the charges lowered or a new method as before long it will be over £10 for 1 item.

attributes.action: Increase Defence Spending to 2.5% of GDP.
attributes.background: NATO guidelines put 2% of GDP as the minimum defence spending for NATO countries. I point out the key word: MINIMUM. 2% is the bare minimum. It is not a "target". We must endeavour to bring our capabilities back up to adequate standards after careless, thoughtless cuts in the SDSR 2010 & 2015.
attributes.additional_details: It is a simple fact that when HMS Queen Elizabeth comes into service 13 Frigates and 6 Destroyers simply won't be adequate to form a Carrier Group whilst maintaining other global operations. We require AT LEAST 8 Type 26's, 12 T-31's and another 2 Destroyers. The RAF can only muster a pathetic 36 Jets whilst Saudi was deploying 100+ daily in Yemen. We call for immediate action to boost spending to 2.5% of GDP as to regain basic, minimum capability as quickly & efficiently as possible.

attributes.action: Oblige all licensed premises to accept Pass Cards as ID and proof of age
attributes.background: Some premises allow Pass Cards to be used as ID, but some pubs and clubs don't allow them and claim they are fake. It is a legit form of identification. Every licensed premise that requires some form of ID to enter should allow Pass Cards just as it allows passports and driving licenses.
attributes.additional_details:
For example I went to a pub with a few friends for a birthday, the bouncer asked where I got it from. I said it’s from the challenge 25 website which has multiple different pass cards and it is a legitimate form of ID. He said nope that is fake, I can get that from ebay or somewhere else online. 

For more information see: http://www.pass-scheme.org.uk/

attributes.action: Provide free prescriptions for those suffering lifelong / incurable conditions
attributes.background: It is unfair that people who have no other option but to take medication for the rest of their lives, due to suffering from lifelong / incurable diseases, conditions or syndromes (such as: arthritis, asthma, heart conditions, etc.) have to pay for their prescriptions until they reach the age of 60.
attributes.additional_details:
Insulin for diabetes sufferers is free, so medication for ALL incurable diseases should also be free of charge.

Hard working tax payers who suffer from such conditions, have to pay for their prescriptions, whereas citizens on JSA can get theirs free of charge. This simply does not make sense.

£8.40 may not seem expensive, but when you are being prescribed 4 different medications per month for the same condition, this amounts to over £400 per year without a pre-paid exemption card.

attributes.action: Make the use of automatic renewals for insurance and other services illegal.
attributes.background: Automatic renewals are used extensively in the insurance market. They are not however confined to insurance services, and you may find things such as annual gym memberships and even dating agencies will automatically renew your contract and take money from your account without prior warning.
attributes.additional_details: Many people I've spoken to have incurred bank charges as a result of auto renewal payments being declined due to there being insufficient funds in their accounts. In many instances this is due to those people having no knowledge that a payment was about to be taken without prior warning.

attributes.action: Change the law so neighbours can't play loud music at anytime not just after 11
attributes.background: In todays world people don't just work 9 till 5 and require sleep at various hrs of the day. Police have no powers to intervene before 11pm or after 7am. People have been forced to move and made ill from being forced to put up with music played unacceptably loud within flats.

attributes.action: Start to pay off the UK's Debt.
attributes.background: We are all told as young people not to spend money which you don't have, so why should the UK government do it. It's not only getting bigger, but is effecting our NHS which should be run like the US government, to fix this tax the rich more, the poor shouldn't have to pay for the rich and vice versa

attributes.action: Increase National Minimum Wage to a minimum of £20/£25 per hour.
attributes.background: Increase the National Minimum Wage to a fair and decent level so those at the lower end of the employment ladder don't just have to survive or fight tooth and nail to get by. Instead of giving people 'benefits' like Tax Credits use that money to reduce Business Taxes so employers can cover the cost.
attributes.additional_details:
People would rather earn a decent wage than feel like they have to be supported on benefits by the government.

Reducing business taxes in this way would encourage more business to set up and invest in their companies. Also would encourage more businesses to set up in the UK.

The government spends an estimated £30 billion a year on Tax Credit. Don't give handouts to people give them a decent wage and some pride in themselves.

attributes.action: Introduce a flat rate of income tax of 15% and increase the threshold to £15,000
attributes.background: Exclude single incomes of less than £15,000 from income tax and National Insurance as these people cannot afford to be taxed. In addition, introduce a flat rate of income tax of 15% to ensure middle and high earners get to keep more of their hard earned money.
attributes.additional_details: The current levels of income tax are too high at 20% and 40%, dependent on income. A staggered tax system acts as a disincentive to earn more. If people had more money through reduced taxation, standard of living would increase and VAT to the government would increase as people invest in more luxuries. Welfare cuts as well as significant cuts in foreign aid spending could potentially cover the reduction in tax revenue.

attributes.action: Limit how much a Estate Agent can charge for a Credit Check for new tenants
attributes.background: Credit searches for new tenants costs the Estate Agent around £7 a search. Most new tenants have to pay the Estate Agent between £120 and £250 for this. It's hard enough trying to fund a house move without the EA taking a huge chunk. This fee needs capping at no more that £50pp

attributes.action: Don't take prosecution powers away from RSPCA, give them more powers.
attributes.background: The Environment, Food and Rural Affairs Committee wants the Government to take away private prosecution rights for the RSPCA. Instead of taking away powers, we should be delivering the RSPCA more rights to be able to seize without Police needing to be present.
attributes.additional_details:
The RSPCA has a 92% conviction rate for cases that they take to the courts, this is more than the CPS.

The Environment Food and Rural Affairs Committee want prosecutions given to the CPS instead.

The RSPCA should have more rights to take animals rather than having to wait 24 hours, or calling the Police as animals could be going through torment whilst waiting for the RSPCA to return.

For emergencies that the Police call them too, they should be given some form of emergency lighting as it can take them hours to arrive.

attributes.action: Make landlords & agents give 24 hours notice to access shared rental housing.
attributes.background: I currently live in a share house where the agency accesses the home unannounced. Because my housemates and I complained, the agency tried to threaten me and we feel like we can't enjoy this new home because the laws regarding 24 hours notice to rentals don't include share houses, but they should.
attributes.additional_details: On citizensadvice.org.uk, it's states that landlords "...should always ask for your permission and should give you at least 24 hours notice." However, if you stay in lodgings where the landlord provides a room-cleaning service or where you share a room with other lodgers, your landlord can enter without permission. All my housemates and I have either had our items tampered with in communal areas or our rooms accessed without permission or without due notice. These exceptions should be illegal.

attributes.action: Make mansard and loft extensions permitted development in non-conservation areas
attributes.background: Mansard and loft extensions for terrace properties require planning permission.  This gives local authorities the power to refuse on design ground even when there is no objections from local residents.  These type of extensions should be automatically permitted except in conservation areas.

attributes.action: When selecting route for HS3 include Manchester to carlisle.
attributes.background: HS2 is meant to provide a link from the North to the south. A full upgrade of the UK railway network is required to reach the actual North of England carlisle  in place of targeted more advanced areas where spending is already in place.

attributes.action: Make 16+ Zip Oyster cards a form of legal age identification for purchases.
attributes.background: Isn't it annoying going to the cinema and being turned away because you don't have any "accepted ID" on you? Trying to buy lottery tickets for your family? It isn't right that to be able to do these things, you have to carry your passport around, when there's a perfectly good ZIP card in your pocket

attributes.action: Government should not allow pilots to work on Christmas day
attributes.background:
This is a petition to bring to attention pilots who fly thousands of miles away from their families on the most precious day of the year for many people! 

Help me petition government to put a ban to flying on Christmas day!
attributes.additional_details:
I am surrounded by pilots, many of whom complain about working in Christmas day. The banks shut, so why shouldn't pilots have a "pilot day"? 

I call on government to help pilots and their families spend their day together. 

If pilots are being forced to fly on Christmas day, their families should be rewarded with free flights and accommodation to enable the families to be together. 

Please call on government to make this a possibility!

attributes.action: Do not ban fireworks to the public but increase the age of sale to 25 minimum.
attributes.background: Thousands of people respectively enjoy garden fireworks and use them accordingly, why should the whole nation have that taken away from them because of a few peoples irresponsible use of fireworks? It's not fair that everyone should pay because of a few.
attributes.additional_details: Fireworks have been used since the 12th century, animals and people have coped fine, animal owners have information widely available to them to help their animals cope. Lifting the age of sale to 25 will help stop the irresponsible use of fireworks. It is simply not fair to spoil it for everyone because of a few!

attributes.action: Make the 6 week holidays shorter by spreading the weeks throughout the year.
attributes.background: The 6 week holidays are far too long and children get sluggish at the start of the new term. School grades and attitudes towards school should improve as more time learning.

attributes.action: I would like the Government to reinstate Child Support Agency!
attributes.background: We need a government run Child Support Agency as the so called Child Maintenance Service is not meeting the correct criteria. Causing a high level of financial suffering for the parent who is raising the child/children. The absent parent is not being forced to supply correct financial  information.

attributes.action: Stop the addictive drug Codeine being sold as an over the counter medicine.
attributes.background:
Many people are finding themselves taking Codeine on a regular basis through over the counter pain killers and cough medicine even when symptoms have stopped.
Codeine is an Opiate drug.
Despite fairly recent warnings on the packets and from sales assistants, people are becoming addicted.
attributes.additional_details:
Information on Codeine addiction and where to get help can be found online.
Many people are using these drugs to relax, get to sleep etc and becoming dependant.
This is a serious problem and health issue with a suprising amount of people finding themselves addicted and sales of these drugs are increasing.
Making these drugs prescription only and providing help for people who have become addicted would be a simple solution to the problem, manufacturers are the only ones benefitting from it.

attributes.action: change the law on websites listing companies without the owners permission
attributes.background: Parliament needs to change the law on how websites list companies without the company owners permission. It should be up to the business owner to decide where and how their business is displayed and advertised, and be removed from any website at the owners request.

attributes.action: Make a legal requirement for realistic road crash simulations of child car seats
attributes.background: Having done countless hours of research on car seats, I purchased a Nuna Rebl for my son based on positive reviews. However, it has now been listed as a dangerous car seat, yet meets the UN ECE R129 standards. Worryingly, these standards are extremely poor, and not representative of actual crashes.
attributes.additional_details:
Currently UN UCE R129 standards require seats to perform well in the following, totally unrealistic, crash simulations: 
Front impact: 31 mph
Rear impact: 18.6 mph
Side impact: 14.9 mph
These of course are not representative of many car accidents. If you hit another car head on, both driving at 20mph (a lower speed limit than in most residential areas), there will be a 40mph impact, which isn't covered by the existing required testing, putting children's lives at risk.

attributes.action: Mandatory Client Money Protection for Letting Agents
attributes.background: The Government is less than lukewarm about making it mandatory that all Landlord and Tenant money is safely held in Client Accounts and covered by insurance policies. Some of our present Landlords have lost thousands with agents that have closed down and run off with money they banked from Tenants.
attributes.additional_details:
A solicitor, conveyancer or even a financial adviser is not afforded the same trust. Unfortunately the small minority of agents do, often, run away with large sums of money!

Why are we as agents so poorly regulated?

Further discussion and details here: https://www.aaronjbarclay.co.uk/should-client-money-protection-be-mandatory. Estate agents in London and beyond should be made to comply.

Please sign if you feel this is a worthy petition.

attributes.action: Require manufacturers & suppliers to label reduction in size/volume of a product
attributes.background: Since the economic downturn in 2009, manufacturers & suppliers of food & other consumer goods such as washing liquids have been reducing the size or volume of products whilst maintaining the same selling price or increasing it. This results in the consumer paying more money for less goods.
attributes.additional_details: Often the reductions are so subtle, that a consumer is unaware that anything has changed. This practice is misleading & unfair & it is time that manufacturers & suppliers are required to clearly mark a reduction in size or volume. This practice has made the weekly shop much more expensive & by labelling the reduction in size, consumers will be better informed to look at alternative products that may offer better value for money. See examples in this Daily Mail article: https://goo.gl/0aUpQF

attributes.action: Restrict private parking charges to reasonable amounts.
attributes.background: It is proposed that the government amend the Protection of Freedom Act 2014 to restrict the amount a private company can issue a parking charge to a fair and reasonable amount and no more than what the local council can issue a penalty notice.
attributes.additional_details:
Every day many parking charge notices are issued to vehicles parking on private land. Normally, the fee to cover the car is a reasonable nominal amount. However, for those that overstay the period the vehicle is covered or parking the car without any cover the charges are unreasonable and far more than the loss of business the proprietor suffers. 

The everyday person in the United Kingdom that uses parking facilities lawfully but from time to time cannot cover their car for entirely adequate reasons are suffering unreasonable financial burdens.

attributes.action: If 20% of a workforce are claiming tax credits  no dividend to shareholders
attributes.background: Any Company  paying its workers so low that they are subsidizing their wages with tax credits, should be barred from paying a dividend. The taxpayer should not be propping up greedy bosses that should  be paying correct wages  to the workers not  to shareholders

attributes.action: Make it compulsory for schools to set up sports teams for both genders.
attributes.background:
"Rugby is for boys," "Netball is for girls." 
Gender inequality in sport exists in schools, clubs and at the elite level.
All pupils should be encouraged to take part in any sport.  How hard is it to set up a rugby team for boys and a rugby team for girls? 
You can make a change!

attributes.action: Ban Votes for anyone over the age of 70
attributes.background: In the referendum most young people- 17 or below did not have the chance to decide their future, where old pensioners were allowed to vote and decide our future for us! We want more control for young people!
attributes.additional_details: Such as in the referendum, despite a petetion and growing debate for votes for 16 year olds, the number of old people is on the increase, due to the baby boomers getting older! Therefore to restrict the age this way it would help keep down the number of old people voting and put more decision in the younger generations.

attributes.action: Give the HSE more powers under the law to regulate gas safety for consumers.
attributes.background: A recent Which? investigation showed that engineers failed to provide boiler servicing which is safe and meets minimum requirements for the job. Of the 6 'big companies' and 4 independent companies checked 70% failed to meet minimum legal requirements. The HSE need legal powers to be effective.
attributes.additional_details:
The Health & Safety Executive must be able to hold Gas Safe and it's engineers to account and ensure Gas Safe registered engineers:

1} are competent to complete a full, safe boiler service, with regular checks on performance

2} have a legal minimum boiler service time

3} complete a clear, detailed report

4} are held to account in the same way as other professions which potentially risk peoples lives

5} HSE should complete robust checks on standards of work & update the registration process.

attributes.action: Make the buying age of tobacco products 16+.
attributes.background:
The minimum age was 16 years of prior to 1994. 
Plus we can smoke at 16 but not buy it? this makes no sense and needs to be changed asap.

attributes.action: All telecoms personnel in the UK should be licensed
attributes.background: I have experienced poor service from a telecoms provider, which resulted in me being given 2.6-2.8 Mb when 10-15Mb was freely available at my home. People who work in the telecoms industry have a great deal of power, and should be licensed and checked before they can work.
attributes.additional_details: I have suffered over the years with a controlled censorship on my business lines resulting in call drop outs at an alarming rate,  yet when I called the 1471 service 99.9% of these callers were unavailable which I find very odd. Yet friends and family and established clients have no problems contacting me. The present system is out of date and Ofcom needs more power to regulate the industry. Security is a major problem - there are 2000 calls a day to Action Fraud.

attributes.action: Standardise ID requirements for all public and quasi-public bodies
attributes.background: At present any public authority (or quasi public authority such as a utility company or railway) can randomly select what ID requirements are needed from members of the public to interact with them.  Surely this could be standardised for all such institutions through very simple legislation.
attributes.additional_details: For instance some PAs (eg the Bank of England if you want to exchange old bank notes) will accept a driver's licence as proof over address, others (eg my local authority issuing a parking permit) will only accept a utility bill less than 3 months old and not if it is copied from an on-line bill.   NB this is NOT a request for introduction of compulsory ID cards.

attributes.action: £500 tax allowance,every 4 yrs for sport for either membership fee or equipment.
attributes.background: To capitalize on the excitement of the Olympics, every 4 yrs a £500 tax free allowance per person could be allocated to spend on  either sports membership (golf for an example) or sport equipment. This will prevent certain sports being only available to the well off.

attributes.action: Introduce a Mandatory 10 year prison sentence for Vehicle theft/ involvement in.
attributes.background: The people of Great Britain are sick of working hard to buy vehicles, only to have them stolen by criminals who do not care. The impact of their crimes affect thousands of people, who suffer untold hardship, financial loss & emotional distress due to crime. The law needs to be a major deterrent.
attributes.additional_details:
Currently the penalty for stealing a vehicle does not fit the crime, many criminals walk free from court with punitive punishments, despite causing huge problems for the victims of their crime.

The law needs to ensure that theft of a vehicle is so harshly punished it will make it unappealing.

attributes.action: Manual workers to retire at 60!!
attributes.background:
We work until we drop!! Is that the idea? Myself and my partner are both manual workers and are 57 years old!! We really can't see ourselves being fit to work until we're 66!! Can you? We're ready to drop now.

Please vote.
attributes.additional_details: Manual workers are more at risk for potential damage to limb and arthritis damage so therefore would cost more in the long run for medical deficiency!! Most of us will end up taking sick leave because we can't manage our jobs. Personally I have worked since I was 14 and am now 57. Is this not long enough!!!

attributes.action: Government to reform the honours system to include posthumous awards
attributes.background: I'm creating this petition to call upon the Government to reform the honours system, so that knighthoods can be awarded posthumously. Its a shame that people that have contributed something for the country but are sadly no longer with us cannot be recognised for their achievements.
attributes.additional_details: A prime example is Bobby Moore. Its now the 50th anniversary of the year of England winning the world cup. He was a leader, a gentleman and credit to this country. Geoff Hurst has been knighted so surely Bobby Moore should be too (posthumously) as he was the Captain of the team, especially in this anniversary year. It would be a very fitting way to celebrate the achievement of the the man and the team.
